title: Tripal DS should trigger a window resize event after showing a pane
body:
## BUG/ERROR report
<!---
INSTRUCTIONS: The following template is meant to provide the information that will help other Tripal
 developers diagnose and reproduce your issue. Follow the directions below to complete the template.
  Feel free to delete sections that are not applicable.
--->



### System information
<!--Please enter the following information (if able). All information is available in your site's administrator report area (Administration Toolbar > Reports > Status Report) -->

* Tripal Version: 3
* Drupal Version: 7.6
* PostgreSQL Version: 9.6
* PHP Version: 7.1

### Issue description
<!-- Please describe your issue here 
Some information you might want to include: the page you're seeing the issue on,  what behavior 
you're experiencing versus what you expect, really anything you think might best help us help you! -->

Tripal DS uses jquery animations to show/hide Tripal panes. Many modules, including tripal_analysis_interpro and tripal_analysis_blast, draw charts that show up after the page has loaded. Since they are in a hidden container, the width/height of the container is 0 by default. This is messing up how modules compute the dimensions of the chart and causing them to display blank results. See screenshot below.

#### Steps to reproduce

<!-- What steps are necessary to recreate the bug/error?  Clear instructions here will make it easier for
 us to fix the problem! -->

see issue https://github.com/tripal/tripal_analysis_interpro/issues/24 for more details on reproducing.

#### Error messages and screenshots
<!-- Please include any error messages you find.  Including them in ``` as below will make the issue
 more readable. -->
<!-- Screenshots can be really helpful to describe the problem! -->

![issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17642511/51313489-f8c56200-1a4d-11e9-82a2-c4021a7fe1cb.png)


### Solution 

By triggering a resize event on the `window` object after the animation has completed, we can simulate the default behavior of the browser. See below for a working example:

```js
           if (typeof Event !== 'undefined') {
               window.dispatchEvent(new Event('resize'));
           }
           else {
               // Support IE
               var event = window.document.createEvent('UIEvents');
               event.initUIEvent('resize', true, false, window, 0);
               window.dispatchEvent(event);
           }
```

By adding this code right after this line, the issue would be fixed.
https://github.com/tripal/tripal/blob/3244f2dc184513d1c4576fb29b2d72e6f61d4413/tripal_ds/theme/js/tripal_ds.js#L65


Thanks!

title: JS function calls after AJAX loading of fields
body:
## Feature Request/Discussion
<!---
INSTRUCTIONS: The following template is meant to structure your feature request. 
  Please keep in mind, this issue may evolve into discussion for an extension module
  if it's decided the feature is not a good fit for Tripal Core.
--->

<!--- Go over all the following points, and select the option in the brackets that applies to you. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
* This feature doesattempt to solve an existing problem with Tripal
* I am open to developing or collaborating on an extension module if this is not a good fit for Tripal Core
<!--- (no pressure here -just good to know upfront :-) ) -->
* This feature is Not Urgent

### Description
<!--- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
When fields load via AJAX (i.e. they are not attached by default to the entity) any content that they provide does not get run through the Drupal.Behaviors infrastructure.  This means that any Javascript/JQuery that normally would get attached to elements in the document don't get attached to returned content.    This is only a problem the first time a page is loaded.  Any subsequent loading of the page uses the field cache so the fields are not loaded via AJAX.   So, on subsequent views of a page all JS in the Drupal.Behaviors should work just fine.  

We need some way for the Drupal.Behaviors code to be called the first time a page is loaded.  One approach is to follow what Drupal does with the `ajax_command_invoke` command which is meant to be used in the `hook_ajax_render_alter` function.   It's not clear to me if we can use that approach or if we need to do something similar.   The AJAX calls for loading fields happen from custom JQuery code in the tripal.js file.

### Your Specific Use Case
<!--- Please describe how you would use this feature in your own Tripal site and why you need it -->
Example where this is a problem is with the Tripal Analysis Blast and Tripal Analysis Interpro modules.  Both of those modules provide a feature viewer for looking at alignments of matches.  Creation of those viewers happens in a Drupal.Behaviors stanza.   Well, actually.... they are being adjusted to be that way.  See https://github.com/tripal/tripal_analysis_blast/issues/8

### Generally Applicable
<!--- Why do you feel this is generally applicable? -->
<!--- Suggest other use cases if possible. -->
I think anyone who has JavaScript interacting with their field contents will need their AJAX to run both after AJAX loading of field content and on normal page loading when fields are coming from cache.

title: Fields disappearing even when not empty
body:
## BUG/ERROR report
<!---
INSTRUCTIONS: The following template is meant to provide the information that will help other Tripal
 developers diagnose and reproduce your issue. Follow the directions below to complete the template.
  Feel free to delete sections that are not applicable.
--->



### System information
<!--Please enter the following information (if able). All information is available in your site's administrator report area (Administration Toolbar > Reports > Status Report) -->

* Tripal Version: 3.x
* Drupal Version: 7.x
* PostgreSQL Version: N/A
* PHP Version: N/A

### Issue description
<!-- Please describe your issue here 
Some information you might want to include: the page you're seeing the issue on,  what behavior 
you're experiencing versus what you expect, really anything you think might best help us help you! -->

When hiding of empty fields for a content type is turned on, then fields that are marked to not auto attach (meaning they should be loaded via AJAX) are automatically removed from the Tripal Pane table.  This is because they are technically "empty" as data has not yet been added to them (it gets added via AJAX).  This is incorrect behavior.  They should not be removed from the table until after their data is loaded.  The `tripal_field_group_table_rows_alter` function is the culprit.

title: [Tripal3]Aliases token not filled (empty)
Is it (still) possible to join Chado data and Drupal field data in Drupal views?
body:
branch: Tripal 3

I tried to create a Drupal view that would allow me to display both data from Chado and Drupal on a same page without any success. On Tripal 2, this could be achieved using Drupal views relationship between Drupal node and the corresponding Chado table. On Tripal 3, I didn't find the possibility to join those 2 sides.

I can only either create a view on "Chado stock" or create a view on "Accession" for instance, but none of them can "reach the other side of the database".

If you create a "Chado stock"-based view, how could you provide a link to the corresponding Drupal entity?

If you create a "Accession"-based view ("Accession" being the Tripal entity that is related to a type of Chado stock), how could you display the related organism common name (stock.organism_id->organism.organism_id, organism.common_name) for each record or a specific picture (stock.stock_id->stock_dbxref.stock_id/dbxref_id->dbxref.dbxref_id/db_id->db.db_id by filtering on a given db.name)?

I used to do it a lot on my Tripal 2 views but this issue prevents me from migrating to Tripal 3 at the moment.

title: Tripal Advisory Committee
body:
This issue summarizes discussion from this issue #344 regarding a Tripal Advisory committee for Tripal.  
The Advisory Committee is different from the Project Management Committee (PMC).  The PMC's role is to provide oversight over code development. It ensures quality standards, approves feature requests, and accepts pull requests.  The Advisory Committee is meant to provide guidance for the future of Tripal.

Here's the current proposal put forth by @mestato:

1. Meetings: once per year (January, pre-hackathon with teleconference option?) and as needed other than that, can be called by PMC
2. Director: elected by board at January meeting, responsible for calling votes, calling additional meetings if needed, and making sure meeting notes are posted and communicated to PMC
3. Responsibilities: board members agree to serve for one year at a time, beginning by attend the yearly board meeting (in person or online) and to respond to issues in a timely manner when requested by the PMC or other board members. Their responsibility is to provide high level advice on steering Tripal which may relate to overall approach, development priorities, upgrade timelines, funding, etc. Issues will be available for full community discussion for x number of weeks prior to a vote
4. Eligibility: anyone who has led a group who has published or maintained/updated a publicly available Tripal module within the past 2 years or has funding for Tripal development (core or extension). 
5. Election: anyone who is eligible and willing is welcome
6. Terms: indefinite since its all volunteer based
7. Decision making: Consensus based, vote called when needed by director, all objections recorded in meeting notes
8. Agenda: items can be set by anyone on PMC or board
9. PMC seat: at least one person from PMC has a seat on the board
10. PMC issues: if PMC wants the board to weigh in on an issue outside the yearly meeting, they can request a meeting by notifying the director

title: Field Pagers
body:
## BUG/ERROR report
<!---
INSTRUCTIONS: The following template is meant to provide the information that will help other Tripal
 developers diagnose and reproduce your issue. Follow the directions below to complete the template.
  Feel free to delete sections that are not applicable.
--->

### System information
<!--Please enter the following information (if able). All information is available in your site's administrator report area (Administration Toolbar > Reports > Status Report) -->

* Tripal Version: 3.x
* Drupal Version:  7.x
* PostgreSQL Version: N/A
* PHP Version: N/A

### Issue description
<!-- Please describe your issue here 
Some information you might want to include: the page you're seeing the issue on,  what behavior 
you're experiencing versus what you expect, really anything you think might best help us help you! -->

When creating a pager for a field you are expected to give it a pager index.  Drupal expects that all pagers have an index this is because you can have more than one on a page and the index is used to distinguish which one the user is expecting to use.  Unfortunately, with fields, we never know how many pagers will be on the page and therefore the field developer cannot properly pick a proper index for the pager.  Instead, we need a way for the entity object to maintain a count of the number of pagers so that it can then be used to set the index number for each pager.

title: Tripal Module Rating System
body:
There has been a discussion among the Project Management Committee (PMC) to implement a module rating system such that others who want to potentially use extension modules for Tripal can judge how well it might work for them before installing it.   It's easy to say a module is Tripal v3 compatible but that doesn't mean it properly uses the Tripal API, or that it provides generic configuration such that another site could easily set it up and use it.  

The PMC proposes a set of qualifications for rating modules as Bronze, Silver and Gold with different criteria that  developers can use to judge their modules. The initial list of potential criteria are below. We open this up for discussion for all developers of Tripal extension modules to comment.  Please comment if you think changes should be made to the lists below.

**Bronze**: 
* Any Tripal version
   * Has a public release that follows Drupal release naming rules.
   * Should install on a Tripal site appropriate for the versions it supports.
   * Defines any custom tables or mviews in the install file (if applicable).
   * Provides Installation and admin instructions README.md (or RTD)
   * Has a license (distributed with module)
* Tripal v3 specific
   *  Adds any needed controlled vocabulary terms in the install file  (if applicable)

**Silver:**
* Any Tripal version
  * Follows Drupal code standards (how to measure this?)
  * Use tripal API functions (is this too generic)?
  * ~~Uses the Chado API: Queries Chado using chado_generate_var, chado_expand_var, the ChadoRecord class or chado_xxx_record functions (except for complicated queries).~~
  * Provides an admin interface to allow for customization
* Tripal v3 specific:
  * Uses the TripalField class to add data to pages (if applicable).

**Gold:**
* Any Tripal version
   * Unit testing is implemented using PHPUnit with the TripalTestSuite or something similar.
   * Continuous integrating is setup (e.g. such as with TravisCI).  
      * Required: execution of unit tests
      * Optional (but encouraged):  code sniffing and testing coverage reports.
   * Project should have a public development branch (following Drupal naming rules) to encourage collaboration and pull requests.
   * Extensive documentation for the module (similar to Tripal User's Guide).
* Tripal v3 specific: 
   * Imports data via Tripal's importer class
   * Tripal 3 fields are 
      * Fully compatible with web services
      * The elementInfo function is fully implemented.
      * query and queryOrder functions fully implemented.
   * Web Services uses Tripal's Web Service Classes.
   


The standards will be given a version number. This way if the rules change we can refer to the version number for the rules.

Sample badges to post on a website?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1719352/49599185-30ac9600-f935-11e8-87d1-32fa288f8b50.png)

edit: scratched the Chado API requirement from Silver

title: API Embedded in RTD with User's Guide and Dev Handbook
body:
So, it is possible to integrate our Doxygen style commenting in Tripal with Sphynx and Read the Docs.  That would place our User's Guide, Developer's Handbook and the API all in one RTD interface.  It would allow us to update the API quicker because we wouldn't have to fight with the Drupal API site we currently maintain.   I really like this idea but there are some caveats.

1.  We have to commit the Doxygen generated XML into the repository so RTD can find it.
2.  We have to add a requirements.txt file so that Sphynx can install the breathe library
3.  We have to manually create a page for each API in our docs folder and use breathe directives to point to the proper API.  It's not hard to do, but just requires someone to do it.
4.  We have to edit *all* of our API functions and add the input type to all of them or breath croaks!  I'll put in a request on the breathe GitHub to see if they can fix that. Otherwise this will be a lot of work and may break stuff!

We did this for the Tripal Galaxy module.  An example can be seen here:  https://tripal-galaxy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/API/api_funcs.html

title: Tripal registration page
body:
* This feature does attempt to solve an existing problem with Tripal
* I am open to developing or collaborating on an extension module if this is not a good fit for Tripal Core
<!--- (no pressure here -just good to know upfront :-) ) -->
* This feature is Not Urgent

### Description
Tracking mechanism for tripal use, so we know how many sites are using it and we can notify them when updates are available.
-Registration page:	
--A message for why this is important.
--Checkbox to disable registration reminder.
--Principal Investigator Contact: Name, Email. (required))
--Site admin contact:  Name, Email
--Description of the site
--Funding Source: agency and grant #, funding period (unlimited number)
--Purpose: (radio) Development or Production (required).
--Provide Tripal (not other 3rd party modules) module usage information (Checkbox).

-How to receive this information on Tripal.info?  
-- First-time registration form submits the info to Tripal.info and a new "registration" node is created.
---Views and data analytic tools can be created as needed with the transmitted info.
--Every month the site pings tripal.info to let us know the site is still active and if applicable module usage so we know if new Tripal modules have been installed.

Tripal.info is in the process of being upgraded to Drupal 8 so the new RESTful web services module in core can be leveraged.


### Generally Applicable
This update will allow us to push out notifications about Tripal and Tripal Extension module updates that are ready for download. Additionally, it will provide more accurate usage statistics since many users are not downloading the module through drupal.org.

The form will be an opt-in registration so users can choose not to register the site if it's a dev site or if they simply do not wish to share that they are using Tripal. Users will be reminded to register the site until they either do so or check the 'disable reminders' checkbox.

Some information you might want to include: the page you're seeing the issue on,  what behavior

By default, every OBO ontology contains the following objects:

[Typedef]

[Typedef] 
id: instance_of

[Typedef] 
id: inverse_of

[Typedef] 
id: union_of 
name: union_of

domain: OBO:TERM

[Typedef]

title: Gene page improvement: child feature field
body:
## Feature Request/Discussion
This issue is a splinter from #100 .  It's a feature request as @laceysanderson and I agree that having better gene pages is a **very desirable thing**. 

### Description

Gene pages aren't great out of the box, and fields just arent designed to work with a typical gene setup.  What do I mean by that?  In short, **Genes need to access child feature information** and they dont, or they do in limited ways.

Lets consider three fields.  I have a vanilla gene here at 
http://167.99.232.220/gene/185
I loaded FASTA sequences for scaffolds, mRNA, CDS, and proteins.  NONE of this information is available on the gene page!  Neither would annotations associated these feature types (unless we loaded them associating via the parent gene via regexp.).


#### Field 1 - transcripts

[Transcripts](https://github.com/tripal/tripal/blob/7.x-3.x/tripal_chado/includes/TripalFields/so__transcript/so__transcript.inc)
The transcript field on the gene page doesnt provide sequences, or any information other than location.


#### Field 2 - sequence 

[Sequences](https://github.com/tripal/tripal/blob/7.x-3.x/tripal_chado/includes/TripalFields/data__sequence/data__sequence.inc) . Per tripal's general philosophy, the sequence field only look as the targeted feature, not related features.  Because I didnt load in the gene FASTA, theres nothing to display, even though i loaded in 4 other feature type fastas, plus the GFF. I thould be able to infer the gene sequence via the GFF, just for starters.

#### Field 3 - protein sequence
[Field code](https://github.com/tripal/tripal/tree/7.x-3.x/tripal_chado/includes/TripalFields/data__protein_sequence)
There are protein sequences associated with this gene, but **indirectly** via the mrna -> CDS.    The protein sequences field therefore does not find them.



# Solution

Some considerations...
* I'd like the solution to work for all feature types, if possible.  Meaning, if im on feature X, it should find and display all features linked to it, nomatter how indirectly.  The field config might allow excluding display of certain SO terms if thast too much.
* Solution should be fast.  We are iterating through each feature_relationship.  I dont want a suite of fields doing that independently and redundantly.  So, we're probably either working on one mega field that displays all child-feature info, or, developing a shared architecture so that it only gets called once per page and cached.
* Sites will want access to, at a minimum, the following info from all children:
  - annotations (feature_cvterm, also blast data)
  - properties  (featureprops)
  - sequences 
   -  coordinate info (featureloc)

Point two sounds to me very similar to cvtermpath for features.  Cvtermpath is a nightmare, BUT for features its much easier to prevent infinite loops, we arent dealing with stanzas, etc.

Point three makes it clear that we are talking about multilpe fields, since displaying annotations AND sequences in the same place is a bit much.

title: Code coverage integration
body:
## Feature Request/Discussion

This is a meta-feature request for Code coverage integration of some kind.  I'm looking into it after a discussion with @childers .    I thought I'd reach out to the community to see if anyone know of any solutions that meet our needs well.

### Impetus

Travis CI is great for code testing, but code reports provide more of a snapshot of the state of your code, with CI.  

Some things this would add to Tripal (:

* STYLING.  If a PR doesnt meet Drupal style standards, our report would tell us.
* Test Coverage.  We would get tools to view test coverage.  Further when people contribute code we would know what the test coverage for their new coverage looks like.
* Problematic code.   Files that are poor code will get graded as such and we can be aware that they need some help.



### Options

When considering options, we need to consider the services offered, the pricing (should be free for an open source project), and the Drupal support  (we need to at least be able to configure the service to expect Drupal's weird extensions, and code styling obviously needs to be set to Drupal standards.)


#### Configure Travis and PHPUnit to generate reports

This is definitely possible.  [see these slides](https://lullabot.github.io/drupal8ci-slides/#/) The below services are flashier but it's an option.

#### Code Climate

https://codeclimate.com/


#### Codacity

https://www.codacy.com/


I'll try and update our options as i try them and get asense for how easy/hard it is to configure for a drupal project.

title: OBO Importer builds malformed terms when loading plant trait ontology (TO) RO sub-terms
body:
## BUG/ERROR report

### System information
<!--Please enter the following information (if able). All information is available in your site's administrator report area (Administration Toolbar > Reports > Status Report) -->

* Tripal Version:3

### Issue description

#### Steps to reproduce
Load the trait ontology.  http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/to.obo

two of our terms lookups are malformed:


```

Performing EBI OLS Lookup for: RO:0002310,056 bytes.
Cannot find the term via an EBI OLS lookup: RO:0002310. EBI Reported: Resource not found. Consider finding the OBO file for this ontology and manually loading it first.
Performing EBI OLS Lookup for: RO:0002577
Cannot find the term via an EBI OLS lookup: RO:0002577. EBI Reported: Resource not found. Consider finding the OBO file for this ontology and manually loading it first.
```
This is because THIS is the call built:

http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/api/ontologies/ro/terms/http%253A%252F%252Fpurl.obolibrary.org%252Fobo%252FBFO_00000500002310

when it should be
https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/api/ontologies/ro/terms/http%253A%252F%252Fpurl.obolibrary.org%252Fobo%252FRO_0002310

so, the namespace is BFO instead of RO.  The OBO actually reflects this so i think its the importer causing the problem.

title: PDO Error on mRNA: negative substring length not allowed
body:
## BUG/ERROR report

### System information
<!--Please enter the following information (if able). All information is available in your site's administrator report area (Administration Toolbar > Reports > Status Report) -->

* Tripal Version: 7.x-3.x
* Drupal Version: 7.x
* PostgreSQL Version: 9.4
* PHP Version: 5.6

### Issue description
I just sync'd some mRNA pages and when I try to view one of them I get the following PDO error:
![screen shot 2018-10-03 at 11 25 34 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1566301/46427612-13720600-c6ff-11e8-8784-812ecbb9e0d8.png)

It appears to be happening on this query: https://github.com/tripal/tripal/blob/7.x-3.x/tripal_chado/api/modules/tripal_chado.feature.api.inc#L244-L308

#### Steps to reproduce
1. Load the data from Tripal DevSeed.
2. Publish the mRNA content type (should be 200 records).
3. Go to TripalContent, and select `FRAEX38873_v2_000001700.1` (I saw this problem a large number of them).
4. Enjoy a PDO error taking over your whole page 😝 

#### Error messages and screenshots
Error message included in text below for ease:
> PDOException: SQLSTATE[22011]: Substring error: 7 ERROR: negative substring length not allowed: SELECT featureloc_id, srcname, srcfeature_id, strand, srctypename, typename, fmin, fmax, upstream, downstream, adjfmin, adjfmax, substring(residues from (cast(adjfmin as int4) + 1) for cast((upstream + (fmax - fmin) + downstream) as int4)) as residues, genus, species FROM ( SELECT FL.featureloc_id, OF.name srcname, FL.srcfeature_id, FL.strand, OCVT.name as srctypename, SCVT.name as typename, FL.fmin, FL.fmax, OO.genus, OO.species, CASE WHEN FL.strand >= 0 THEN CASE WHEN FL.fmin - :upstream <= 0 THEN 0 ELSE FL.fmin - :upstream END WHEN FL.strand < 0 THEN CASE WHEN FL.fmin - :downstream <= 0 THEN 0 ELSE FL.fmin - :downstream END END as adjfmin, CASE WHEN FL.strand >= 0 THEN CASE WHEN FL.fmax + :downstream > OF.seqlen THEN OF.seqlen ELSE FL.fmax + :downstream END WHEN FL.strand < 0 THEN CASE WHEN FL.fmax + :upstream > OF.seqlen THEN OF.seqlen ELSE FL.fmax + :upstream END END as adjfmax, CASE WHEN FL.strand >= 0 THEN CASE WHEN FL.fmin - :upstream <= 0 THEN FL.fmin ELSE :upstream END ELSE CASE WHEN FL.fmax + :upstream > OF.seqlen THEN OF.seqlen - FL.fmax ELSE :upstream END END as upstream, CASE WHEN FL.strand >= 0 THEN CASE WHEN FL.fmax + :downstream > OF.seqlen THEN OF.seqlen - FL.fmax ELSE :downstream END ELSE CASE WHEN FL.fmin - :downstream <= 0 THEN FL.fmin ELSE :downstream END END as downstream, OF.residues FROM chado.featureloc FL INNER JOIN chado.feature SF on FL.feature_id = SF.feature_id INNER JOIN chado.cvterm SCVT on SF.type_id = SCVT.cvterm_id INNER JOIN chado.feature OF on FL.srcfeature_id = OF.feature_id INNER JOIN chado.cvterm OCVT on OF.type_id = OCVT.cvterm_id INNER JOIN chado.organism OO on OF.organism_id = OO.organism_id WHERE SF.feature_id = :feature_id and NOT (OF.residues = '' or OF.residues IS NULL) ORDER BY fmin) as tbl1 ; Array ( [:upstream] => 0 [:downstream] => 0 [:feature_id] => 2654 ) in chado_query() (line 1704 of /var/www/dev/tripal/sites/all/modules/tripal/tripal_chado/api/tripal_chado.query.api.inc).
```

title: New API function tripal_add_user_file()
body:
## Feature Request/Discussion
<!---
INSTRUCTIONS: The following template is meant to structure your feature request. 
  Please keep in mind, this issue may evolve into discussion for an extension module
  if it's decided the feature is not a good fit for Tripal Core.
--->

<!--- Go over all the following points, and select the option in the brackets that applies to you. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
* This feature does not attempt to solve an existing problem with Tripal
* I am open to developing or collaborating on an extension module if this is not a good fit for Tripal Core
<!--- (no pressure here -just good to know upfront :-) ) -->
* This feature is Not Urgent

### Description
<!--- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
An API function that developers can use when they need to upload a file into a tripal user's folder (sites/default/files/tripal/users/#uid) for any reason.

body:
## BUG/ERROR report
<!---

 developers diagnose and reproduce your issue. Follow the directions below to complete the template.

* PostgreSQL Version: 9.5
* PHP Version: 7.x

### Issue description
<!-- Please describe your issue here 
Some information you might want to include: the page you're seeing the issue on,  what behavior 
you're experiencing versus what you expect, really anything you think might best help us help you! -->

I don't know if it's really a bug, but I noticed that deploying a tripal 3 instance is much slower than it was for tripal 2. Like >15min instead of <5min.
It makes testing more painful, locally, and with travis (for tripal itself, but also python-tripal).
It is the `Creating common Tripal Content Types` step that takes a lot of time.
I've looked into the code a little: it seems like calls to the drupal `field_info_max_weight` functions are slow, when this function calls `field_info_instances` and `field_info_extra_fields`
And `field_info_max_weight` is called from tripal like this (at least):
`tripal_create_bundle_fields` -> `field_create_instance` -> `_field_write_instance` -> `field_info_max_weight`

As a clue, there is a warning in the doc of `field_info_instances` talking about using `field_info_field_map` instead.

I don't know if there's anything that can be done, I gave up when I saw that it could come from the drupal code... Just creating the issue in case someone is interested. Feel free to close.

#### Steps to reproduce

Install a new Tripal instance and wait.

title: chado_get_organism_select_options shouldnt throw errors with default parameters for tripal 3
body:
## Feature Request

### Description

`chado_get_organism_select_options()` gives this error if called without parameters:

```
Undefined table: 7 ERROR: relation "public.chado_organism" does not exist LINE 1: SELECT * FROM public.chado_organism CO ... ^: SELECT * FROM public.chado_organism CO INNER JOIN chado.organism O ON O.organism_id = CO.organism_id ORDER BY O.genus, O.species ; Array ( ) in chado_query() (line 1715 of /Users/chet/UTK/tripal/sites/all/modules/tripal/tripal_chado/api/tripal_chado.query.api.inc).
```

One needs to set Synced = FALSE to prevent this (`chado_get_organism_select_options(FALSE)`.  

I think this API call could be improved by checking if the site doesnt have a public.chado_organism table and, if it doesn't, instead checking the bio_data_x table to consider published records as those with entities.

title: Should deleting an entity also delete the corresponding chado record?
body:
## Feature Request/Discussion

<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->

- [x] does this feature attempt to solve an existing problem with Tripal?


### Description

When a user deletes an entity via the GUI, the corresponding chado record is not deleted.

from @chunhuaicheng 

>However, I think it [deleting an entity] should delete the corresponding chado record as well. Here is our use case:
>Our curator uses the web interface to delete unwanted pubs that were imported by the Tripal pub importer. After she deletes the pubs, they still show up in the Tripal Pub Search (/find/publications) results, even after applying you fix.

I'm inclined to agree with him.  here was my response:

>Deleting a tripal entity, intentionally, does not delete the chado record (thats my recollection of this discussion i've had with stephen).

>I think this is not always the desired behavior, for example in the case described. I would go so far as to say that deleting the chado record should be the default behavior. That said, maybe we need to support both? Deleting the record brings up a dialogue that lets you specify you want to also delete the associated chado record ?



### note

Please do not confuse this issue with the bug reported in #652 and its corresponding PR #653

title: Tripal Home Page and About pages Text
body:
The blurb at the top of the home page and the text on the About page probably do not give a proper sense for what Tripal is.  Primarily, I don't think it drives home the value of using Tripal as a means for interacting with a larger community of developers and genomic sites.  The true strength of Tripal is not so much all of the functionality that it has but rather the community around it and the ability to share code and collaborate with others.  

I would like to rework that text on the website.  This issue  is meant to collect our thoughts on what really should be stated about Tripal on the home page and about pages of Tripal.info.

title: gene/mRNA feature versioning
body:
Hello All,

I have a question about how others are handling sequence feature versions.

I have a group that is developing gene/mRNA models. They are using an ensembl like system for versioning of gene and transcript id. And they want to maintain a history of previous versions.

They plan on incrementing a digit after the id when a new version is generated.

gene nv2m00005394.1
mRNA nv2m00005394.1.mRNA.1

```
Chr11	GFF3Conv	gene	3598792	3603486	.	-	.	Alias=Sox9;Name=nv2m00005394.1;ID=nv2m00005394.1
Chr11	GFF3Conv	mRNA	3598792	3603486	.	-	.	ID=nv2m00005394.1.mRNA.1;Parent=nv2m00005394.1
```


How should I handle this? Create a new feature for each version and mark the old one obsolete? How do I make it easy for users to find the correct ID when they don't know there has been an update?  I have some ideas, but it would require the geneID and mRNAIDs to have different bases, ie nv2g00005394  (change g->m) for gene and nv2m00005394 for mRNA.

Any advice would be fantastic!!!

Thank you!
Sofia

title: TripalImporters should have the option to save the file for field usage
body:
## Feature Request/Discussion
- [x] does this feature attempt to solve an existing problem with Tripal?
- [x] are you open to developing or collaborating on an extension module if this is not a good fit for Tripal Core (no pressure here -just good to know upfront :-) )
- [ ] do you **Need** this feature ASAP?

### Description


The TripalImporter class should provide a public static variable for "saves the file".  If TRUE, it should store the file somewhere, and attach that file location as a property to the analysis the importer is associated with.    The term could be TripalImporter_file_location, and the value would be the path to the file.

Bingo bango, you can now write a simple field that attaches to analysis, and offers a download of the raw data. 

### Your Specific Use Case
Our biomaterial loader for tripal_analysis_expression allows users to download expression data at the analysis level.  Currently we just re-generate the file from the data in the db, but for big data sets this takes a long time.  In discussing how to fix by cacheing hte file ahead of time, we realized... its the same file we fed the Importer!  So, we would make our expression data Importer cache the file somewhere, and then modify our field to retrieve that file.


### Generally Applicable

Take the FASTA and the GFF loader.  If you stored the files afterwards, you could write a GFF and FASTA download field that attaches to analysis and offers a simple way to download the raw file.

We currently manually put this file somewhere, and then write html to link the download, which goes in the description field.  A universal field approach is **much saner**.  It lmakes it easier to have a more consistent UX too!

I think this is a great feature for any site that wants to make raw data, particularly FASTA or GFF files, available to users.  If the variable is FALSE by default, its totally backwards compatible.

title: Tripal 4 Proof of Concept.
body:
<!---
INSTRUCTIONS: Our intent is to use github as an open forum to help community members connect.
If you are looking to do any of the following, you are in the right place! and Thank You!
  - Ask for help/documentation/clarification of Tripal Functionality and Site Building/Management
  - Discuss controlled vocabulary terms for your data
  - Ask for input on site/module design questions
  - State your intent to develop a specific extension module
  - Really any type of discussion or question -we want to hear from you!
--->
In our Tripal User's Meeting from Today ([see meeting notes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NSU7Q-J2HBU5T3Yp3hvGNAztrVAX1AdojNX5t5LiA8Q/edit#heading=h.4moho3kt5r8d)), we discussed how we should approach Tripal v 4.  Here is a summary of the motivations and challenges.

**Challenges**
-  The learning curve of Tripal + Chado + Drupal can be too much for new programmers
-  Drupal's hook system is a bit foreign to programmers trained in object oriented languages that have built in abstraction and member proctions.
-  For small sites, hiring a local expert Drupal programmer can be challenging. These programmers often make more money than an academic group can support.  Additionally for small sites individuals must perform multiple duties and Drupal training can be overwhelming given their full list of duties.
- PHP: is not the language that informaticians and data scientists are using.  And it is these individuals who are most likely to want resources that Tripal provides.  It is challenging for some groups to find not just Drupal programmers but individuals who understand data science/informatics.
-  Many folks desire to use other web frameworks for various reasons:
  - The programmers that they have access to come with a variety of existing experience with other frameworks. It can be faster to get things accomplished by taking advantage of other current experience.
  - Some frameworks are easier to develop specific visualizations or tools.  
  - It is not clear how to integrate these frameworks into Drupal.

**Needs:**
- We need to preserve the sense of community that has built around a single framework (PHP/Chado/Drupal). it is our community, cooperativeness, and sharing that has helped secure funding among our respective groups.
- We need to support those sites that are heavily invested in Drupal and remember that Drupal provides much of the infrastructure needed to build large interactive research communities around data.

**Proposed Solution**
To address the challenges above it was decided to explore the idea of dividing Tripal into two pieces: a library that houses the non-Drupal components of Tripal, and a Drupal module that interacts with the library to provide a Drupal interface for Tripal.  This approach would allow others to take advantage of the infrastructure provided by Tripal without being forced to use Drupal.  And for folks who do want to use Drpual it would allow for easier integration of other frameworks with the Drupal site that can  use the same underlying API to access data in Chado (or other data stores).  We will perform a proof of concept (POC) study to see if Python is an appropriate choice for the Tripal library.  Python was selected to try to help promote greater adoption of Tripal by informaticists who are traditionally not web developers with no experience using PHP.  Python offers a lower barrier to entry for these folks to be involved in web-development.

**Proof of Concept**
To help ease and promote long-term adoption we will perform a proof of concept (POC) study.  The POC will do two things:
1.  It will test how well a Tripal Python library can interact with a PHP-based Tripal module for Drupal, and how much work it will take to ensure a Python library can provide all of the structure needed to not interfere with existing Tripal sites and their current development plans.
2.  It will test to see how well the Tripal community will rally around a Python implementation.  Moving "core" Tripal code to Python is not an easy undertaking and we need support of the larger Tripal community to make it happen in a timely manner.   Note: if we cannot garner enough support for the Python migration then separation of core Tripal code into a PHP library would be more pratical

Here we welcome comments, suggestions and protests about this plan!

title: Necessary ChadoRecord Improvements
body:
## Feature Request/Discussion
<!---
INSTRUCTIONS: The following template is meant to structure your feature request. 
  Please keep in mind, this issue may evolve into discussion for an extension module
  if it's decided the feature is not a good fit for Tripal Core.
--->

<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] does this feature attempt to solve an existing problem with Tripal?
- [ ] are you open to developing or collaborating on an extension module if this is not a good fit for Tripal Core (no pressure here -just good to know upfront :-) )
- [ ] do you **Need** this feature ASAP?

### Description
<!--- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
PR #632 added a new ChadoRecord class for querying of Chado. It was added specifically to help with fixes/re-write of the OBO loader and as such was merged in without it's full featureset in order for the fixes to make it into the stable 3.0 release. This Issue describes the features and checks needed for the class before it's ready to replace portions of the existing API. NOTE: current API functions will remain for backwards compatibility but will become wrappers for the class functions.

### Fixes and Features Needed
From the original review of the PR:
- We need to be able to specify values through the foreign key:
```php
             $record->setValues([
               'name' => 'My Favourite Plant',
               'uniquename' => 'Plectranthus scutellarioides Trailing Plum Brocade',
               'organism_id' => [ 'genus' => 'Tripalus', 'species' => 'databasica' ],
               'type_id' => [ 'name' => 'sample', 'cv_id' => [ 'name' => 'Sample processing and separation techniques' ] ],
             ]);
```
 - We need to follow foreign keys when returning values.
 - It needs to be a little more fault tolerant.
      - In update & delete, if there is no record_id set, we can execute find to attempt to look it up
      - Need to support the same validation we have in the existing functions.
 - We don't have support for many of the options we did using the api functions directly.
 - We can only select a single record? This is a barrier to replacing chado_select_record().
 - Improve performance by using `RETURNING` for insert to retrieve the newly inserted id.

### Points for Discussion
- Should ChadoRecord->values() be a `chado variable` and should we have generate/expand var functionality in this class?
- What should be checked when values are set? This was easy in the original API functions because it was specific to the action being performed but with the class it's less clear. For example, If I'm intending to find, I should be aloud to not set all required values but if I'm executing an insert/update, then I need them. Perhaps required should be checked in insert/update rather then setValues?
- Should we throw exceptions or use tripal_report_error? or both?

title: Select List Views Exposed Filter for Tripal Fields
body:
## Feature Request/Discussion
<!---
INSTRUCTIONS: The following template is meant to structure your feature request. 
  Please keep in mind, this issue may evolve into discussion for an extension module
  if it's decided the feature is not a good fit for Tripal Core.
--->

<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] does this feature attempt to solve an existing problem with Tripal?
- [x] are you open to developing or collaborating on an extension module if this is not a good fit for Tripal Core (no pressure here -just good to know upfront :-) )
- [x] do you **Need** this feature ASAP?

### Description
<!--- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
I need to be able to choose select list and/or autocomplete as the exposed filter form element for various Tripal Fields when designing my search views. Ideally there would be a very generic views handler that would select from the table the field is attached to finding the currently used values and using them to populate the list. I could also allow it to be configured to just provide all values from the linked table as a faster option. Autocomplete would query on the fly.

I would generically implement it for all foreign key fields and use tokens from the table the foreign key references to make the human-readable option generic. For example, for the feature table, you could use a select list for the organism_id, type_id and dbxref_id; for the organism_id select list the tokens available would be all columns from the organism table.

This is handled in Drupal by having two fields you can add in the views UI: `[field name]` for the straight textfield and `[field name] (Allowed Values)` for the select list. For Drupal Fields the allowed values are set in the instance settings and thus no querying is needed.

Are we content with two options in the views UI for each field attached to a chado foreign key? Also are we content querying for the options? Or should I require options be set in the views ui?

### Your Specific Use Case
<!--- Please describe how you would use this feature in your own Tripal site and why you need it -->
Specifically I need:
- organism_id => scientific names
- type_id => cvterm name
- project/analysis => name

### Generally Applicable
<!--- Why do you feel this is generally applicable? -->
<!--- Suggest other use cases if possible. -->
I feel select lists in exposed filters are more friendly to users and general expected in web forms.

title: CDS field does not support CDS loaded via FASTA loader only
body:
## Feature Request/Discussion
The CDS field was fixed in this PR by @spficklin  https://github.com/tripal/tripal/pull/453
The field looks for CDS in the `load` function starting with the featureloc table:

```php
$feature = chado_expand_var($feature, 'table', 'featureloc', $options);
    $featurelocs = $feature->featureloc->feature_id;
```

This works so long as CDS were loaded via the GFF.  If a user loaded the CDS sequences using the FASTA importer, specifying the relationship to a parent feature that way, there would be no `featureloc` entry and the field would show no results.

The field should therefore look in feature_relationship as a backup if no results or perhaps via a admin settings form.  (I'm less in favor of the form since this will likely be lost to most users).

### Your Specific Use Case
doesn't  affect HWG but there might be a site out there that has CDS not loaded via GFF.

title: Tripal Collections are very slow to create for Drupal Search API Views
General table prefixing issue in chado_query
body:
Tripal Versions: 2.x and 3.x (13/06/2018)
Drupal Version: not relevant
PostgreSQL Version: not relevant
PHP Version: not relevant

In tripal_core.chado_query.api.inc, the chado_query function prefixes tables using the curly brackets {} for Chado tables and square brackets [] for Drupal tables. The following piece of code is currently used:
```
 $chado_schema_name = chado_get_schema_name('chado');
    $drupal_schema_name = chado_get_schema_name('drupal');
    $sql = preg_replace('/\{(.*?)\}/', $chado_schema_name.'.$1', $sql);
    $sql = preg_replace('/\[(\w+)\]/', $drupal_schema_name.'.$1', $sql);
```
This raises 2 issues:
1) when the user wants to use curly or square brackets for other things that table names, it will be a problem. For instance, if I'd like to select any feature with a uniquename that begins with capital A or B, I would write a query like that (use "drush php" for testing):
```
$sql_query = "SELECT * FROM {feature} WHERE uniquename ~ '^[AB]';"
$results = chado_query($sql_query);
drupal_set_message('Query: ' . $results->getQueryString());

```
Such code will in fact return nothing while there should be some results as the query will be turned into:
`SELECT * FROM chado.feature WHERE uniquename ~ '^public.AB';`

Then

2) replacing the square brackets with just "public." will break Drupal behavior: Drupal uses curly brakets arround table names in order to prefix them with the database prefix used by the Drupal installation (@see https://api.drupal.org/api/drupal/includes%21database%21database.inc/7.x ). For some reasons, people may want or need to prefix all Drupal tables with something and removing curly brackets around Drupal table names prevents Drupal from doing its job.
Some people may wonder why using a table prefix: there are many cases in which it can actually be useful. The first one I think of is when you want to share Drupal users between several Drupal instances. It is possible to specify in your settings.php files that the user table are not prefixed while all the other Drupal tables are. Then when a user is created on a Drupal instance or another, it will be also created on other (well it's a bit more tricky than this but it works).


I'm sorry I don't have a pull request to fix that (yet) and I didn't came up with a good solution yet but if people have ideas to discuss for a fix, feel free. I just wanted to raise the issue so it would be known and people having trouble using queries like mines would understand why sometimes, they might not have expected results... (and also, using Tripal prevents them from using Drupal table prefixing feature).

title: chado_table_exists problem
body:
### System information
<!--Please enter the following information (if able). All information is available in your site's administrator report area (Administration Toolbar > Reports > Status Report) -->

* Tripal Version: 7.x-3.x
* Drupal Version:  7.x
* PostgreSQL Version: 10.3
* PHP Version: 7.2


### Issue description
<!-- Please describe your issue here 
Some information you might want to include: the page you're seeing the issue on,  what behaviour you're experiencing versus what you expect, steps to reproduce...  really anything you think might best help us help you! -->
The chado_table_exists function is used to check if a Chado table exists.  It maintains a global variable $GLOBALS["chado_tables"] where it keep track of all Chado table it has seen during the session.  This helps with reducing the number of expensive database queries to see if a table exists.

It normally works just fine, but it can be problematic if a table is deleted in the same session that it is checked for again.  I had this problem when writing unit tests for mviews.  See PR #404 My proposal is to remove this code as I don't recall how much of a performance hit it really saves.


<!-- PS. Also feel free to ask questions, start discussions, suggest improvements We welcome any and all feedback! -->

title: Easy PubMed Importer
body: We need an easy way via the GUI to import publications. We have the more complicated publication importer for automating import of new pubs.  But if someone just wants to import a list of PubMed IDs they have to use a drush command. It would be easy, and useful, to have a little form for importing publications from PubMed using IDs.

title: Regular updating chado materialized views
body: As a suggestion, it would be great if the materialized views in `tripal/storage/chado/mviews` could be updated automatically and regularly, so that the materialized view would be up to date with any additional elements added to the database.

title: Discussion: Future Tripal - Governance
body:
I'm starting this issue as a place for discussion about the creation of more formal rules to govern how we accept code into Tripal and how Tripal should look going forward.  We have a really good opportunity with Tripal v4 and Drupal 8 to streamline development.  I'm specifically leaving this vague to solicit thoughts regarding issues.  

However I would like to add a few items do get the discussion going and please feel free to add your own.  

1)  What code should be included in "core" Tripal?  Should we move some code out as extensions? (i.e. for Tripal v4/Drupal 8)
2)  What protocol should we follow for pull requests?  Do we establish quality standards, rules about who should accept pull requests and how do we resolve conflicts if there is a difference of opinion on a pull request.
3)  Dorrie has suggested we form an advisory committee to provide high-level guidance to the Tripal community.   What are your thoughts on that and what would that committee look like?

title: Tripal Collections + Drupal Search API Incompatibility
body:
### System information
* Tripal Version: 7.x-3.x
* Drupal Version: 7.x

### Issue description
Currently the Tripal Collections Views Handler requires the attached view to be using the query plugin `tripal_views_query`. This is not the case for views based on the Drupal Search API. Furthermore, the current Tripal Collections Views Handler form is geared towards displaying options for a single entity type.

### Solution
We need to make a new Tripal Collections Views handler compatible with Drupal Search API views. Luckily, Tripal Collections already support collections containing multiple entity type (Tripal content types) so it's more a matter of supporting the generic query plugin for views and providing a good UI for choosing additional fields.

title: Documentation needed for adopting non-Chado schema in Tripal 3
body:
Tripal3 supports non-Chado schema per announcement.  It will be very useful to have documentation to implement this feature.

At NCGR we have developed a new generic schema (outside our Chado instance) for RNASeq/gene expression data and have been serving this expression data via a Drupal module.  My specific need is to explain the schema to Tripal so that I can develop a Tripal extension that integrates well with other data in Chado.
--Sudhansu Dash
